channel.title: Low Poly Character
channel.description:
Rate, Hate, Masturbate. Made this with no tutorials, that is why the head looks like complete shit. Has around 1880 triangles when triangulated. I really like the outcome (besides the head). And with no further ado, the model. [img]http://img546.imageshack.us/img546/3135/human1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img835.imageshack.us/img835/716/human2.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img42.imageshack.us/img42/8214/human3k.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img269.imageshack.us/img269/8890/human4.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img716.imageshack.us/img716/8996/human5.jpg[/img]

item.title: Low Poly Character
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:13, topic:411904”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=513162.msg3727155#msg3727155 date=1314355890]

His calves reach out as far as his ass. Definitely bring those in. Because of that the feet are to far back.

I used this reference.
http://www.the-blueprints.com/blueprints/humans/humans/32708/view/athletic_male/
[/quote]
Lol no ones calves are that large…[/quote]
Mine are. :3

item.title: Low Poly Character
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Yeah, you should use triangles to collapse faces for animation right?
Like this: http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v305/Neo_God/hands.jpg
Also I would love to see your human body. Taking human anatomy 2nd and 3rd tri; hoping it will help me with correct anatomy when sculpting.

Read full topic

item.title: Low Poly Character
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

kirikugi:

on the chest between the breasts/boobs or wtf ever u call man tits lol.

It seems the education system has failed.
Pecs, or Pectorals

While the model is OK poly count wise, the structure makes animating for that model very unpractical. For example, as is, should you use armatures for animation, when you lower the arm, it will stretch/bend the mesh around the base of the body in an unnatural way.

The reason anatomic humans are so hard to model isn’t because getting it to look right is hard, deformation structure adds a whole new aspect. Hence why in animated movies such as “Up,” and “Despicable Me” consist of simple bodies, with spaghetti arms/legs (or large meaty arms), as opposed to well structured, anatomically correct characters. While that may have also been done stylistically in the movies, they do so keeping deformation in mind. All in all though, I would say its a decent first attempt. Even the head isn’t too"off," excluding the obvious details such as lacking a mouth. If you would like, PM me and I’ll show you my un-finished human base I made before graduation, as it will give you a good idea of how to structure the mesh of a human body.

Read full topic

item.title: Low Poly Character
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Especially on the face. I couldn’t get the feel on how to make a face. May watch some tutorials or just use it as a base mesh for sculpting.

shrogg:

Good job, but I think that you should re-do the chest area, its… well its the only thing i can see that needs work

Make it so it is actual pecs? Didn’t really feel like adding the extra polys… probably should of though.

Read full topic
